\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 39475}

\subsection*{The Fun is Over}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Annie}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 100 mg & oral & Hydrocodone & daily\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 30 mg & oral & Pharms - Diazepam & daily\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 &  repeated & oral & Alcohol & liquid\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 150.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
Wow what a wonderful high I tell myself as I take my first 30 mg of hydrocodone in the A.M.  It no longer sedates me but rather acts as speed without the side effects.  Within two hours I am looking for the same euphoria again so I take two more 10 mg. hydrocodones but I can't seem to reach the same high.  By evening my mood swings are so severe from the massive amounts of drugs that I go into a panic.  I relieve the panic with high doses of valium and sometimes alcohol.  Now I am so confused and scared I cry myself to sleep with more valium.  I awake in the morning to start the whole pattern again.  I get to enjoy about two hours out of the 24 hour day.  I am an addict, I am dying.  I know that getting and chasing that high is wonderful.  I know that being young and experimenting is fun.  I wish I had a second chance.

\end{document}
